name: 1-chloropropane
source: Dreisbach R. R. Physical Properties of Chemical Compounds; Vol. III; American Chemical Society; Washington; 1961.
Reason: 1-chloropropane has a melting point of -109.4°C. The chlorine atom introduces a significant increase in melting point due to the strong electronegativity and the ability to form hydrogen bonds, which can raise it by approximately +20°C. The methyl group also contributes to the melting point due to its ability to participate in hydrogen bonding, which can add around +10°C.
